chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Martino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges. Court grants a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin on 05-01-2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
With credit for 90 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9), the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery Martino

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery Martino

Prior: 1437A N 52nd Street, West Milwaukee, WI 53219
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 90 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges. Court grants a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin on 5/1/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, Notice of a Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and a letter on behalf of defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant Jeffery Martino in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Jeffery Martino in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court orally amended count 1 to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisc. Stats. 947.01(1) and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.
Received and Filed, State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statement and all Evidence Gained as a Result of Same.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Received and Filed, Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements.

Court ordered defendant to continue being monitored by Justice Point. Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety and is to be tested by drug screens and PBT's. Defendant to attend treatment at Serenity Inn in the morning, and is to maintain employment.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety and is to be tested by drug screens and PBT's. Defendant to attend treatment at Serenity Inn in the morning, and is to maintain employment.
